title: Devfile object

persistVolumes.description: Defines whether volumes should be stored or not. Defaults to `true`. In case of `false` workspace volumes will be created as `emptyDir`. The data in the `emptyDir` volume is deleted forever when a workspace Pod is removed for any reason(pod is crashed, workspace is restarted).

editorFree.description: Defines that no editor is needed and default one should not be provisioned. Defaults to `false`.

___projects.description: Description of the projects, containing names and sources locations
___projects.title: The Projects List

___clonePath.description: The path relative to the root of the projects to which this project should be cloned into. This is a unix-style relative path (i.e. uses forward slashes). The path is invalid if it is absolute or tries to escape the project root through the usage of '..'. If not specified, defaults to the project name.

___source.description: Describes the project's source - type and location
___source.title: The Project Source object

___location.description: Project's source location address. Should be URL for git and github located projects, or file:// for zip.

___branch.description: The name of the of the branch to check out after obtaining the source from the location. The branch has to already exist in the source otherwise the default branch is used. In case of git, this is also the name of the remote branch to push to.

___sparseCheckoutDir.description: Part of project to populate in the working directory.

___startPoint.description: The tag or commit id to reset the checked out branch to.

___commitId.description: The id of the commit to reset the checked out branch to. Note that this is equivalent to 'startPoint' and provided for convenience.

___tag.description: The name of the tag to reset the checked out branch to. Note that this is equivalent to 'startPoint' and provided for convenience.

___components.description: Description of the workspace components, such as editor and plugins
___components.title: The Components List

___memoryLimit.description: Describes memory limit for the component. You can express memory as a plain integer or as a fixed-point integer using one of these suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, K. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki

___reference.description: Describes raw location of plugin yaml file.

___id.description: Describes the component id. It has the following format: {plugin/editor PUBLISHER}/{plugin/editor NAME}/{plugin/editor VERSION}

___registryUrl.description: Describes URL of custom plugin registry.

___referenceContent.description: Inlined content of a file specified in field 'reference'

___selector.description: Describes the objects selector for the recipe type components. Allows to pick-up only selected items from k8s/openshift list

___reference.description: Describes absolute or devfile-relative location of Kubernetes list yaml file. Applicable only for 'kubernetes' and 'openshift' type components

___parentSelector.description: The selector on labels of the top level objects in the referenced list in which to search for containers. If not specified, the objects to search through can have any labels.

___parentName.description: The name of the top level object in the referenced object list in which to search for containers. If not specified, the objects to search through can have any name.

___command.description: The command to run in the component instead of the default one provided in the image of the container. Defaults to null, meaning use whatever is defined in the image.

___args.description: The arguments to supply to the command running the component. The arguments are supplied either to the default command provided in the image of the container or to the overridden command. Defaults to null, meaning use whatever is defined in the image.

___containerName.description: The name of the container to apply the entrypoint to. If not specified, the entrypoint is modified on all matching containers.

___memoryLimit.description: Describes memory limit for the component. You can express memory as a plain integer or as a fixed-point integer using one of these suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, K. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki

protocol.description: Defines protocol that should be used for communication with endpoint. Is used for endpoint URL evaluation

public.description: Identifies endpoint as workspace internally or externally accessible.

discoverable.description: Identifies endpoint as accessible by its name.

secure.description: Identifies server as secure or non-secure. Requests to secure servers will be authenticated and must contain machine token

___port.description: The container port that should be used as endpoint
___port.title: The Endpoint Port

___command.description: The command to run in the dockerimage component instead of the default one provided in the image. Defaults to null, meaning use whatever is defined in the image.

___args.description: The arguments to supply to the command running the dockerimage component. The arguments are supplied either to the default command provided in the image or to the overridden command. Defaults to null, meaning use whatever is defined in the image.

___image.description: Specifies the docker image that should be used for component

___volumes.description: Describes volumes which should be mount to component

items.description: Describe volume that should be mount to component

___name.description: The volume name. If several components mount the same volume then they will reuse the volume and will be able to access to the same files
___name.title: The Volume Name

___containerPath.title: The path where volume should be mount to container

___mountSources.description: Describes whether projects sources should be mount to the component. `CHE_PROJECTS_ROOT` environment variable should contains a path where projects sources are mount

___alias.description: The name using which other places of this devfile (like commands) can refer to this component. This attribute is optional but must be unique in the devfile if specified.

___type.description: Describes type of the component, e.g. whether it is an plugin or editor or other type

___env.description: The environment variables list that should be set to docker container

___commands.description: Description of the predefined commands to be available in workspace
___commands.title: The Commands List

___name.description: Describes the name of the command. Should be unique per commands set.

___actions.description: List of the actions of given command. Now the only one command must be specified in list but there are plans to implement supporting multiple actions commands.
___actions.title: The Command Actions List

___workdir.description: Working directory where the command should be executed

___referenceContent.description: The content of the referenced configuration file that defines one or more actions in the editor-specific format

___component.description: Describes component to which given action relates

___reference.description: the path relative to the location of the devfile to the configuration file defining one or more actions in the editor-specific format

___name.description: The name of the devfile. Workspaces created from devfile, will inherit this name
___name.title: Devfile Name

___generateName.description: Workspaces created from devfile, will use it as base and append random suffix. It's used when name is not defined.
___generateName.title: Devfile Generate Name
